title: All-Party Parliamentary Beer Group
purpose: To promote the wholesomeness and enjoyment of beer and the unique role of the pub in UK society; to increase understanding of the social, cultural and historic role of brewing and pubs in the UK and their value to tourism; to broaden recognition of the contribution of brewing and pubs to employment and to the UK's economy; to promote understanding of the social responsibility exercised by the brewing and pub industries; to support the UK's brewing industry worldwide.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Bees and Pollinators
purpose: To inform parliamentarians about bees, other pollinators and beekeeping and to campaign and raise awareness of impacted issues.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Betting and Gaming Group
purpose: To act as a forum for the discussion of issues concerning betting and gaming in the UK.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Bingo
purpose: To represent the interests of the bingo industry in Parliament.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic Business Owners
purpose: To bring together parliamentarians from all parties and both Houses with key players in Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic (BAME) businesses to promote the successful growth of BAME businesses across the UK.  A key aim is to promote an inclusive national strategy of policy, support and resources to enable the growth of BAME owned businesses for the benefit of the overall UK economy.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Blockchain
purpose: To ensure that the United Kingdom plays a key role in the potential opportunities that blockchain can unlock for our economy, society, governance and the provision of public services.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Blood Cancer
purpose: To raise awareness and promote the needs of blood cancer patients with Parliamentarians, government, NHS and charity stakeholders, and to create a forum for broader issues affecting blood cancer patients.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Boxing
purpose: To engage with government and Parliament to support all aspects of boxing. To set out the benefits of boxing to individuals and wider society; reduce the barriers to participation in boxing; celebrate the success of our nation’s boxers; and highlight the potential for boxing to tackle urgent social needs in the UK.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Boys' Brigade
purpose: To support and promote the work of the Boys' Brigade.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Brain Tumours
purpose: To raise awareness of the issues facing the brain tumour community in order to improve research, diagnosis, information, support, treatment and care outcomes.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Breast Cancer
purpose: To raise the profile of breast cancer issues within parliament. The group provides a forum for MPs and Peers to discuss important issues affecting patients with breast cancer. It encourages dialogue between parliamentarians, government, the NHS and those living with or affected by the disease.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Bridge Group
purpose: To develop an awareness of the benefits of bridge, with particular reference to the ways in which it can develop skills in young people, and help those who are retired or about to retire.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Britain-Pakistan Trade and Tourism
purpose: To ensure that trade and relations between Britain and Pakistan are considered and promoted cross-party and across both Houses; and to advance the benefits of tourism between Pakistan and the UK.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for British Bioethanol
purpose: To raise awareness of the industry, its economic impact, the supporting role it plays for British agriculture, and the environmental benefits of the bioethanol it produces. To promote the introduction of E10 fuel in the UK, help provide information and provide a greater understanding amongst parliamentarians and consumers.

title: British Council All-Party Parliamentary Group
purpose: For parliamentarians to learn more about and better understand the British Council, and to support the British Council, offering advice and encouragement in both its everyday and long term work.

title: British Curry Catering Industry All-Party Parliamentary Group
purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians to consider and discuss the role and contribution of the British curry catering industry.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for British Hindus
purpose: To support and promote the interests of British Hindus to Parliament; to encourage political parties in the UK to actively engage with the British Hindu community; to consider campaigns and issues on behalf of British Hindus; to press for more government engagement with the Hindu community; to highlight and acknowledge the exceptional and significant contribution of the British Hindu community in all walks of life.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on British Jews
purpose: To promote understanding of the aspirations and challenges of the UK's Jewish community, with topics including religious freedom, faith based education, welfare and social justice. To celebrate the culture, contribution and achievements of the UK's Jewish community.

title: British Museum All-Party Parliamentary Group
purpose: To establish a partnership between Parliament and the British Museum, including work with local and regional museums, and an understanding of its role as a leading world museum.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on British Muslims
purpose: To inform Parliament and parliamentarians of, and harness their support for, the aspirations and challenges of British Muslim communities; to promote and celebrate their contributions; and to investigate the forms, manifestations and extent of prejudice, discrimination and hatred against Muslims in the UK.

title: British Parliamentary Awards All-Party Parliamentary Group
purpose: To recognise the most influential organisations in UK global relations by bringing together and promoting Britain's highest achieving men and women on a local, national and international level as part of a new Global Britain campaign.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Defence of the Interests of British Property Owners in Cyprus
purpose: To promote, defend and provide a parliamentary focus for the defence of the interests of British property owners in Cyprus.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on British Turks and Kurds
purpose: To encourage debate and engage in discussion about issues affecting Britain's Turkish and Kurdish communities.  To promote the contribution and achievements of the Turkish and Kurdish communities in Britain.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Broadband and Digital Communication
purpose: To further the roll out of broadband in rural and urban areas, and to look at digital communication across the UK.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Building Communities
purpose: To promote the social value of placemaking and good design for communities.  The group focuses on how to improve community involvement in infrastructure, housing and other developments, and seeks to highlight the benefits of an upfront and informed approach to growth in local areas.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Excellence in the Built Environment
purpose: To promote excellence in the built environment.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Bullying
purpose: To highlight, discuss and record the frequency, severity, and consequences of bullying on children and young people, and the effect it has on their parents or carers, peers, their school and others.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Business Brexit
purpose: To develop evidence based policy recommendations for the current government that will support and encourage businesses of all sizes to prosper in the post-Brexit environment, making an assessment of what legislation will remain and what will be repealed following the repealing of the ECA, and what may legislation may be added to improved the business environment now the UK is no longer bound by the EU laws and conditions.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Business Improvement Districts
purpose: To promote parliamentary and public understanding of the importance of the role of Business Improvement Districts within the UK and beyond.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Business Support and Engagement
purpose: To assess how businesses can be better supported by government, the private sector and third party organisations, and to utilise Parliament to provide engagement and networking forums for businesses, to help enhance existing, and develop new, supply chains between businesses; to share ethical business practices; and to promote corporate responsibility.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Friends of CAFOD (Catholic Agency for Overseas Development)
purpose: To meet and discuss matters of interest to the work of CAFOD, current humanitarian crises and the role of the Catholic church in international development.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Cancer
purpose: To keep cancer on the political agenda, monitor implementation of government initiatives, provide briefings to parliamentarians, and ensure policy-making is evidence-based and patient-centred.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Cannabis: Harmful Effects on Developing Brains
purpose: To inform members of both Houses of Parliament and, using sound scientific and medical evidence, to raise awareness and stimulate discussion about the impact of cannabis on developing brains.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Carbon Capture and Storage
purpose: To provide a forum for the discussion of issues relevant to the development of carbon capture and storage (CCS) technologies for the purposes of mitigating carbon dioxide emissions from energy intensive industries, heating and power.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Carbon Monoxide Group
purpose: The APPG is the leading forum for Parliamentarians to discover, discuss and promote ways of tackling carbon monoxide poisoning in the UK.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Cardiac Risk in the Young
purpose: To promote amongst parliamentarians the issue of cardiac risk in the young (CRY); to inform policy decisions and public debate relating to CRY; and to enable communications between interested parties and relevant parliamentarians.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Carers
purpose: To encourage equality of opportunity for carers in the UK, liaising with carers' organisations, lobbying governments and promoting legislation on their behalf, to promote awareness in Parliament of carers' and former carers' needs; to liaise with members of the UK's devolved administrations; to link with international bodies, including carers' organisations.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Cats
purpose: The All-Party Parliamentary Group on Cats (APGOCATS) is a group of MPs, Peers and associate organisations with an interest in feline welfare, aiming to promote and further feline welfare. APGOCATS seeks to support discussion and debate about what the public, politicians and the government can do to further feline welfare.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Ceramics
purpose: To broaden the understanding of ceramic manufacturing in the UK among parliamentarians, to promote ceramic manufacturing as an asset within the UK economy, and to provide a forum for parliamentary discussion on the issues impacting the industry.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Challenger Banks and Building Societies
purpose: To review the regulations of the banking and financial sector and to promote fair competition, removing entry barriers and encouraging diversity of service.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Channel 4 Group
purpose: To provide a forum for discussion of Channel 4's content, strategy and contribution to public service broadcasting in the UK, as well as wider relevant regulatory issues.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Charities and Volunteering
purpose: To provide a forum for discussing the issues affecting the voluntary and community sector.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Charity Retail
purpose: To build awareness and understanding of the charity retail sector in the UK among parliamentarians and those within local government.

title: Chemical Industry All-Party Parliamentary Group
purpose: To brief Members on issues affecting chemical and pharmaceutical businesses in the UK and act as a forum for Members to express views.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Child and Youth Crime
purpose: To find (or identify or formulate) practical solutions and policies for those aged between 0-25, be they perpetrators or victims of crime, and to look at the cause and effect of gun and knife crime, persistent and prolific offending, gang crime, bullying, abuse, domestic violence, drug and alcohol addiction and homelessness.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Child Contact Centres and Services
purpose: To raise greater awareness in Parliament of the work of the National Association of Child Contact Centres in supporting children during separation; and of the important role of child contact centres and services in facilitating contact with non-residential parents.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Childcare and Early Education
purpose: To  provide a forum for parliamentarians to constructively examine and debate policy affecting non-maintained childcare and early education providers.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Children
purpose: To raise greater awareness in the Houses of Parliament of aspects of the well-being of the nation's children aged 0-18 years, and our obligations under the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child; and to work with children, young people, children's organisations, and politicians from all sides, to promote first-class government policy for children.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Children in Wales
purpose: To consider issues of concern for children and young people in Wales.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Children of Alcoholics
purpose: To champion the cause of children of dependent and hazardous drinkers, to conduct research, to raise issues of concern, and to make recommendations to government and other policy makers.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Children who need Palliative Care
purpose: To inform policy which secures the best quality of life and death for the growing number of babies, children and young people with life-limiting or life-threatening conditions. To improve awareness of their needs and to make sure they are understood by those who can help, including government and parliament.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Children, Teenagers, and Young Adults with Cancer
purpose: To raise awareness of the issues affecting children, teenagers, and young adults with cancer and their families in Parliament.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Children's Media and the Arts
purpose: To raise awareness of the issues around children's arts and media within a wide cultural, social and educational context, and support the provision of both as specified in Articles 17 and 31 of the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Choice at the End of Life
purpose: To promote greater patient choice at the end of life, particularly over where, when and how one dies. This group believes that mentally competent adults should have the right to refuse treatment, and provided sufficient legal safeguards are in place, the right to an assisted death.

title: All Party-Parliamentary Group for The Parliament Choir
purpose: The study and practice of choral music in order to foster public knowledge and appreciation of such music by means of public performance. The promotion of the art of singing and music by means of assistance to young singers and musicians and by the provision of scholarships, bursaries and prizes for singers.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Christians in Parliament
purpose: To support Christians of all denominations and parties in their work in the Houses of Parliament.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Cider Group
purpose: To promote the cause of cider as a drink; raise its profile; and inform and educate people about its role and importance, especially in rural areas.

title: All-Party Parliamentary City Regions Transport Group
purpose: To promote parliamentary debate and promote discussion of transport issues in the metropolitan areas.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Civic Societies
purpose: To discuss issues related to civic society and the civic movement; to realise these issues on the parliamentary agenda; and to provide a forum for an exchange of views between stakeholders with an interest in making places more attractive, enjoyable and distinctive.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Classical Music
purpose: To bring together parliamentarians who have an interest in and wish to further the appreciation of classical music; to act as an interface between British orchestras' on and off-stage activities, the wider classical music industry, including broadcasters and the recording industry, and key decision makers and opinion formers; and to look at the potential for establishing parliamentary classical music awards and promoting the supporting young musicians.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Climate Change Group
purpose: To inform the climate change discussion between parliamentarians, business leaders, NGOs and academics, and to accelerate action to address it.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Coalfield Communities
purpose: To promote awareness among MPs of issues that continue to face former coalfield areas; to support the regeneration and economic development of coalfield communities; to raise the profile of the economic, social and environmental issues affecting such areas and to press government to implement effective and sustainable policy solutions.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Coastal Communities
purpose: To investigate various issues that affect coastal communities, establish policy with cross-party support and promote economic growth in coastal communities.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Commercial Radio
purpose: To seek a better understanding between broadcasters and parliamentarians about the vital role that radio plays in our communities and our economy.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Commonwealth
purpose: To inform Members about the Commonwealth Secretariat's developments to strengthen the Commonwealth network; to keep members aware of the range of non-parliamentary activities and programmes carried out underneath the Commonwealth brand, both on governmental and non-governmental levels; and to take advantage of opportunities within the developing Commonwealth network for Britain's political and commercial activities and for Britain's positioning in the new international landscape.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Commonweatlth Games
purpose: To support and promote the Commonwealth Games, and particularly the 2022 Commonwealth Games, from bid to legacy - including home nations, participating sports and athletes taking part in the games.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Communities Engagement
purpose: To help parliamentarians to be aware of, and respond to, the various issues and challenges facing members of the diverse communities in the UK.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Community Development in Europe
purpose: To raise awareness among British Parliamentarians of methods and best practice to improve the stability of families and communities; to develop contacts accordingly between European parliamentarians; and to evaluate evidence from methods and good practice, including that from voluntary and private institutions and from partnerships between public and private sectors.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Community Transport
purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians to demonstrate and celebrate the value of community transport in Parliament and learn about the experiences of community transport charities and their service-users in shaping public policy where improved accessibility and mobility would be of benefit.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Competition for Heathrow Expansion
purpose: To explore the effects of a lack of competition in the current operation of Heathrow Airport and the process to decide who will deliver and operate Heathrow's future infrastructure.  To consider the potential for aviation passengers of introducing competition at Heathrow and giving serious consideration to alternative proposals for the development.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Complex Needs
purpose: To give parliamentarians a greater understanding of the barriers faced by those with complex needs or dual diagnosis who may have to negotiate a number of issues (mental health, substance misuse issues) in their lives while often living in deprivation and lacking access to stable housing or meaningful daily activities.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Conception to Age Two - First 1001 Days
purpose: To promote a holistic approach to the antenatal and post natal period, specifically with regards to the early years and infant mental health; to hold evidence-based enquiries into best practice for the 1001 critical days to help policymakers make informed decisions on provision in this period; and to uphold cross-party consensus for this age group.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Connected Places
purpose: To bring parliamentarians together with leaders in central and local government, civil society and commerce, to develop and enable sustainable and efficient smart solutions to the challenges of modern living, and support the work of the Connected Places Catapult.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Consumer Protection
purpose: To provide a voice for ordinary retail consumers across a range of sectors in the UK economy; to raise awareness of issues, rights and obligations in the field of consumer protection with parliamentarians and the wider public.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Continence Care
purpose: To break the taboo by raising awareness of continence issues for adults and children and to promote cost effective funding for continence services and provision.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Corporate Governance Group
purpose: To develop and enhance the understanding of corporate governance at Westminster. The focus is on promoting responsible leadership of business, so that the interests of shareholders and other stakeholders are properly protected.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Corporate Responsibility Group
purpose: To promote debate and understanding of corporate responsibility.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Anti-Corruption
purpose: To raise awareness of the impact of international corruption and to enhance and strengthen UK anti-corruption policies and mechanisms.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Counter-Extremism
purpose: To aid Parliament by alerting it to the dangers of extremism, helping to identify the implications of extremism and the responses society can take to combat its origins and effects, complementing the activities of relevant select committees, supporting the output of related APPGs, and offering leadership in challenging existing extremism, how it acts, and how it can be combatted.

title: County All-Party Parliamentary Group
purpose: To promote the importance of county councils to parliamentarians.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Strengthening Couple Relationships and Reducing Interparental Conflict
purpose: To promote and develop marriage and relationship skills and support, identifying best practice within the UK and internationally, to help reduce interparental conflict as well as family breakdown, and support both adult and child mental health and well-being.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Craft
purpose: To enhance the understanding and promotion of craft in the UK, and to ensure craft skills are supported and passed on to future generations.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Creative Diversity
purpose: To engage with industry and government to identify and tackle obstacles to diversity in the creative sector.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Credit Unions
purpose: To provide a forum for discussing the work of credit unions and the need to secure a supportive environment, including enabling legislation and proportionate regulation, to allow credit unions to scale up and provide inclusive financial services to many more people.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Cricket Group
purpose: To foster and improve relations between Parliament and cricket at all levels.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Crossrail Group
purpose: To promote the successful completion of Crossrail, and other related matters.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Customer Service
purpose: To raise awareness and understanding of customer service, including its impact on economic growth.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Cyber Security
purpose: To be a forum for cyber security briefings and discussion. To address developments in cyber security systems and techniques affecting consumers, business and its role in defence, the UK economy/society and the Critical National Infrastructure.  To examine security, identity, regulation and fraud. To raise awareness and understanding for non-specialists.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Cycling Group
purpose: To promote the use of bicycles as a means of transport and to raise both inside and outside the House the practice and status of cycling.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Dairy
purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians to discuss issues of interest on the dairy industry and ensure parliamentarians are fully briefed on developments or potential issues within the dairy supply chain.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Dalits
purpose: To draw attention to the discrimination against Dalits (the former untouchables) wherever it occurs and support attempts to eliminate it.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Dance Group
purpose: To promote dance as an art form and as an important element of healthy living and the fight against obesity, and to promote its education and social benefits.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Darts
purpose: To promote the sport of darts and support its continued development, as well as to inform and educate members of both Houses of Parliament and the wider public about the contribution of the sport to personal development, communities and charitable causes.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Data Analytics
purpose: To disseminate knowledge, generate debate and facilitate engagement on data analytics amongst Members of both Houses of Parliament.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Deafness
purpose: To promote the interests of people who are deaf or have a hearing loss.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Abolition of the Death Penalty
purpose: To campaign for the abolition of the death penalty in all circumstances and to raise awareness of death penalty cases.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Deaths Abroad and Consular Services and Assistance
purpose: To improve Foreign and Commonwealth Office consular services and assistance, including the process for bereaved families who have had loved ones murdered abroad, die abroad in suspicious circumstances, missing abroad, or in jail abroad.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Debt and Personal Finance
purpose: To provide a forum for MPs and peers to discuss debt and personal finance issues; to monitor legislative and other developments in this area; and to provide an opportunity for liaison between members and consumer organisations with an interest in these issues.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Deliberative Democracy
purpose: To promote the understanding and spread of deliberative democracy, including the greater use of citizens assemblies, citizens conventions and citizens juries.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Dementia
purpose: To raise awareness of dementia among parliamentarians and to influence legislation and policy making in order to improve the lives of people with dementia and their carers.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Dentistry and Oral Health
purpose: To act as a focus for dental and oral health issues in Parliament, and work to raise the profile of dentistry.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Design and Innovation Group
purpose: To encourage the exchange of knowledge and understanding between Parliament and the design industry and innovation communities, helping to raise the profile of design both inside and outside of Parliament.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Diabetes
purpose: Raising awareness for Diabetes and the issues of diabetic people across the UK.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Diasporas, Development and Migration
purpose: To promote parliamentary and public understanding of the key issues affecting diaspora communities in the UK, and to expand their contributions to international development. The group will connect parliamentarians with diaspora organisations and academics to inform policy on how diaspora contributions can be harnessed for greater impact.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Digital Currencies
purpose: To promote an appropriately regulated environment in which digital currencies may grow, and to raise awareness of digital currencies as an alternative means of financial investment and transactions.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Digital Identity
purpose: To raise awareness of Digital ID issues by providing a forum for briefings and discussion. The group will address how Digital ID systems and techniques affect consumers and businesses and its role in the smooth working of the UK economy and society. The group will promote inclusion and understanding for non-specialists.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Digital Skills
purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians, educators  and employers to promote the importance of digital skills and to encourage a greater understanding of digital skills for personal, educational and career development.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Disability
purpose: To work on all-party basis within Parliament for the interests of all disabled people, their families, friends and carers.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Any Disability Signage
purpose: To work with parliamentarians and key stakeholders to research, discuss and promote any disability public signage that truly reflects the range of disabilities that exist across society that are both visible and invisible.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for District Councils
purpose: To work to promote the interests of district councils, support closer working with parliamentarians and to raise awareness of the opportunities for districts in shaping the evolving local government agenda.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Diversity and Inclusion in Science, Technology, Engineering and Maths
purpose: To increase diversity and promote the inclusion and progression of people from diverse backgrounds in Science, Technology, Engineering and Maths (STEM), and to encourage  government, parliamentarians, academics, businesses and others to work towards a STEM sector that is inclusive to all. To consider and influence changes in policy that will lead to this outcome.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Dog Advisory Welfare Group
purpose: To explore, highlight, discuss and challenge dog-related activities, legislation, and trends with the overall aim of improving the health and welfare of the UK's dogs and dog owners, and society in general.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Domestic Violence and Abuse
purpose: To work towards the elimination of domestic violence and abuse, to highlight issues arising for survivors and specialist support services, and to contribute to the development of policy and legislation in this area.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Drones
purpose: To examine the use of drones (unmanned aerial vehicles) by governments, for domestic and international, military and civilian purposes.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Drug Policy Reform
purpose: To discuss drug policy reform based on available evidence and with a health focus.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Friends of Durham University
purpose: To promote Durham University as a local, national and global centre of teaching, learning and research excellence and a vital contributor to the local community and economy of County Durham, the wider North-East and beyond.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Dyslexia and Other Specific Learning Difficulties
purpose: To understand Dyslexia and other specific learning difficulties and the need to keep government appraised of the situation in schools, education and in general in the UK.  The group will also look at what statutory and non-statutory bodies are achieving in this field. The aim is to achieve a dyslexia friendly society by enabling individuals with dyslexia to achieve their potential across all ages and sectors of society.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Dyspraxia
purpose: To raise awareness of Dyspraxia/DCD and Neuro diverse conditions and its impact on those with the condition.  To share ideas, and act as a link between Parliament and organisations and charities involved with this issue.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the East Coast Main Line
purpose: To campaign on securing investment for one of the UK's most strategic rail routes; on improving passenger experience, capacity and reliability; and on shorter journey times - as well as on the economic growth that could be unlocked in the areas the East Coast Main Line serves.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the East Midlands
purpose: To bring together MPs and Peers from across the East Midlands region, in coordination with leaders in local government, commerce and civil society, to identify priorities for development and maximise future investment in the region, to the benefit of all its communities.

title: East of England All-Party Parliamentary Group
purpose: To bring together east of England's MPs and Peers with elected local leaders - and the private and third sectors - to give a strong political voice for policies which support the east of England's economy and promote its potential as a place to work, study, live and invest.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Eating Disorders
purpose: To improve policy, in particular improving access and treatment for people affected by eating disorders and measures that support prevention and early intervention.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Economic Development
purpose: To bring together economic development practitioners, policy makers and local leaders to ensure no parts of the UK economy are left behind.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Education
purpose: To promote and stimulate debate across all sectors of education.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Eggs, Pigs and Poultry
purpose: To raise issues of concern and opportunity to the egg, pig and poultry sectors.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Electoral Campaigning Transparency
purpose: The APPG will evaluate current UK electoral campaigning laws, interviewing key experts and practitioners in the field, and seeks to use the findings to introduce legislation ensuring that our electoral campaigning laws are fit for purpose in the modern era.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Electric Vehicles
purpose: To engage parliamentarians interested in electric vehicles.  The group will consider issues relating to manufacturing, energy supply, infrastructure requirements, and safety, amongst others. The group will also consider the impacts of automated vehicles, low carbon fuels and other forms of electric mobility.  The APPG will bring together manufacturers, businesses, media, NGOs and experts to share information, promote awareness and debate future policy options.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Endometriosis
purpose: To raise awareness of endometriosis and investigate how those who suffer from the condition can receive the support they need.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Energy Costs
purpose: To promote evidence-based discussion on all aspects of energy costs; to inform energy policy decisions and public debate; and to enable communications between interested parties and relevant Parliamentarians.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Energy Intensive Industries
purpose: To provide a forum for MP's and Peers to discuss and learn about issues of concern to the UK's energy intensive industries.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Energy Storage
purpose: To engage parliamentarians interested in energy storage technologies and their applications, bringing them together with businesses, NGOs, and experts in the field of energy storage to share information, promote awareness and debate future policy options.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Energy Studies
purpose: To look at all aspects of energy and help industry, academia and government to work together.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Engineering Group
purpose: Enabling contact and involvement with parliamentarians and the engineering profession but with a special emphasis on young engineers.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Entrepreneurship
purpose: To encourage, support and promote entrepreneurship. It also ensures that Parliament is kept up-to-date on what is needed to create and sustain the most favourable conditions for entrepreneurship.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Environment Group
purpose: To raise awareness of environmental issues in both Houses of Parliament.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Epilepsy
purpose: To raise awareness of epilepsy among parliamentarians and to engage with individuals and organisations in supporting the promotion of the needs of the epilepsy community.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Justice for Equitable Life Policyholders
purpose: To seek justice for Equitable Life policyholders.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Esports
purpose: To support esports.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on EU Relations
purpose: To provide a forum for cross-party discussion on the UK's relationship with the European Union; to contribute to the debate around key issues in the UK-EU negotiations; and to make the case in public and in parliament for a close relationship with the European Union.

title: The All-Party Parliamentary Group on Explosive Threats
purpose: To consider the humanitarian consequences of explosive weapons and the benefits of mine action and Counter Improvised Explosive Device work. Through research and inquiry advocate for appropriate policy change, act as a focal point for debate and exchange of ideas, views and information.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Extraordinary Rendition
purpose: To examine extraordinary rendition and related issues, in response to allegations of British involvement in the extraordinary rendition programme.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Eye Health and Visual Impairment
purpose: To inform and educate parliamentarians about the importance of high quality eye care for the prevention of eye disease, sight loss and blindness and for the eye health of the nation; and to promote better understanding of visual impairment and greater social inclusion.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Fair Business Banking
purpose: To put forward policy recommendations to government that encourage a finance system that allows enterprise to flourish and business to thrive.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Fair Fuel for UK Motorists and UK Hauliers
purpose: To represent major issues that impact on UK drivers, from motorists to hauliers. Notably fuel taxation, congestion and toxic charges, parking costs, roads investment, fairer treatment for diesel owners, solutions to lower emissions, cleaner fuel incentives and transparent pricing at the fuel pumps.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Fairs and Showgrounds
purpose: To help the industry in convening meetings with government departments who are introducing legislation to change existing legislation to the detriment of the fairs and showgrounds industry.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Fairtrade
purpose: To promote Fairtrade within Parliament; to deepen the relationship between local Fairtrade organisations and parliamentarians and to further raise awareness of the importance of Fairtrade.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Faith and Society
purpose: The APPG on Faith and Society aims to highlight the contribution to society by faith-based organisations, to identify best practice, and to promote understanding of the groups providing innovative solutions around the country.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Families in the Early Years
purpose: To promote best practice in the early years, and explore opportunities for policy change in supporting families with young children.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Family Business
purpose: To promote and facilitate communication and understanding between the UK family business sector and members of both houses.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Farming
purpose: To promote all aspects of farming and contribute to policy making as the industry prepares to leave the European Union.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Female Genital Mutilation
purpose: To scrutinise the government and public sector's work in seeking to end the practice of female genital mutilation (FGM) in the UK and abroad.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Film Industry Group
purpose: To enhance understanding of and promotion of the British film industry and film culture in the UK.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Financial Crime and Scamming
purpose: To allow parliamentarians to understand the nature of financial crime and scamming, its impact on society and on vulnerable and susceptible citizens; and to address issues on how we appropriately respond to these challenges.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Financial Education for Young People
purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians and organisations to discuss the current provision of financial education in schools, further education and higher education, and ensure that all young people - regardless of background - are equipped to make informed financial decisions.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Financial Markets and Services
purpose: The APPG is an informal cross-party interest and educational group. It was established to provide parliamentarians with a unique forum for briefings and constructive debate on issues relating to the wholesale financial sector with senior city practitioners, advisors, economists and academics.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Financial Technology
purpose: To raise awareness in Parliament of the growing importance of Financial Technology (FinTech) to the UK economy, to policy making and to consumers. It aim to promote a regulatory framework that encourages a growing, inclusive and competitive FinTech Industry.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Fire Safety and Rescue Group
purpose: To meet and discuss topical fire safety and rescue issues with appropriate specialists in these fields.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Fisheries Group
purpose: To promote and support the UK fishing industry in Parliament.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on a Fit and Healthy Childhood
purpose: To promote evidence-based discussion and produce reports on all aspects of childhood health and wellbeing including obesity; to inform policy decisions and public debate relating to childhood; and to enable communications between interested parties and relevant parliamentarians.

title: Flags and Heraldry All-Party Parliamentary Group
purpose: To promote the flying of the Union Flag and flags associated with the UK, British territories, dependencies, the Commonwealth, heraldry, British symbols and related issues.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Flood Prevention
purpose: To discuss and further flood prevention across the UK, and minimise the impact of flooding on members of the public and British businesses.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Folk Arts
purpose: To promote folk arts.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Food and Drink Manufacturing
purpose: To act as the voice of food and drink manufacturing in Parliament. The Group serves to raise the profile of the food and drink industry - the UK's largest manufacturing sector, allowing MPs and Peers to explore issues affecting the industry through a programme of events, topical discussions, and site visits.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Food and Health Forum
purpose: To provide a cross-party, independent forum for the exchange of views and information on food policy and to provide an environment for well informed debate; and the opportunity to contribute to the development of policies on food, diet and health.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Food Waste
purpose: To bring together parliamentarians with an interest in this issue; to facilitate informed discussion with policy-makers, the food industry and environmental and food redistribution organisations; to promote policies which will reduce food waste.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Foodbanks
purpose: To look at the rise of foodbank use in the UK and reasons behind the rise.

title: Football All-Party Parliamentary Group
purpose: To hold meetings for parliamentarians about football issues and raise matters of importance with the football authorities.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Football Club Group
purpose: To play football and raise money for charity.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Football Supporters
purpose: To represent the interests of paying football supporters at both professional and semi-professional football (soccer) matches in the UK and abroad.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Forestry
purpose: A successful forestry and wood-processing sector is positive for the economy, environment, biodiversity, recreation and health. But its future is under threat unless urgent action is taken. The sector needs a secure supply of timber and woodlands must be managed responsibly. The APPG will help tackle both of these issues.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Formula One
purpose: To support the sport and industry of Formula One.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Foster Care Work
purpose: To bring together parliamentarians, foster care workers, and experts to discuss and promote measures to improve the state of fostering in the UK; and to work to raise the profile of both the problem and its solutions in Parliament.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Fourth Industrial Revolution
purpose: To support and promote the Fourth Industrial Revolution (4IR) in Parliament and encourage Government, Parliamentarians, academia, the private sector, and other stakeholders, to engage with 4IR-related issues.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Freeports
purpose: To promote freeports as a vehicle for economic growth to benefit the national and local economies.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Frozen British Pensions
purpose: To bring together parliamentary supporters of the case to unfreeze British state pensions overseas and to campaign for reform.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Fruit and Vegetable Farmers
purpose: To raise awareness and understanding of the fruit and vegetable industry and to provide the voice of fruit and vegetable farmers inside and outside Parliament.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Fuel Poverty and Energy Efficiency
purpose: To maintain awareness in Parliament of fuel poverty issues; to monitor and comment on progress against government targets across the UK to eradicate fuel poverty; to advocate policies that deliver affordable warmth for low income and vulnerable households with emphasis on improved domestic energy efficiency and efficient heating systems.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Funerals and Bereavement
purpose: To provide a forum for the discussion of funeral and bereavement issues.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Furniture Industry Group
purpose: To raise awareness of the furniture industry and to publicise and promote the industry in the UK in order to protect jobs and investment.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Further Education and Lifelong Learning
purpose: To promote and develop the interests of further education, adult learning, skills sectors and to advise government ministers on matters of concern to those sectors.

title: Fusion Energy All-Party Parliamentary Group
purpose: To inform and advise parliamentarians on the present status of research; how to maximise UK industry income and export potential; how fusion can benefit from government investment; how fusion fits into the new research landscape under UKRI; and how to fully exploit the synergies between fusion research and advanced nuclear fission technologies.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Future Generations
purpose: To raise awareness of long-term issues; to explore ways to internalise longer-term considerations into today's decision making; to create space for cross-party dialogue on combating short-termism in policy making.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Gambling Related Harm
purpose: To address the issues associated with gambling related harm.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Game and Wildlife Conservation
purpose: To provide a forum for discussion of science-based game and wildlife conservation policies in the countryside.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Gardening and Horticulture Group
purpose: To promote and facilitate communication and understanding between representatives of the world of gardening and horticulture and Members of both Houses.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on General Aviation
purpose: To promote the objective - as set out by the British Government - of making the UK the best country in the world for General Aviation through inspiring both current and future generations to take up science, technology, engineering and mathematics, thereby creating high-tech jobs and growth in our economy.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Genetic Haemochromatosis (Iron Overload)
purpose: To raise parliamentary awareness and public understanding of Genetic Haemochromatosis (GH), its prevalence and implications.  To drive policy change to improve the welfare of GH patients across the UK.  To influence ministers, parliamentarians, government bodies and NHS representatives to improve patient pathways through the UK healthcare and support systems.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Prevention of Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
purpose: To raise awareness and build coalitions to prevent conflicts and genocides around the world.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Global Education
purpose: To raise greater awareness of the factors affecting education in developing countries, and the government's obligations to help meet international goals for education for all. To work with all parties, international development organisations, education stakeholders (including unions) both nationally and internationally, to help secure a good quality education for all.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Global Health
purpose: To provide a parliamentary platform to identify and debate global health issues and concerns, raise the profile of global health within Parliament and government, and to prepare reports and make recommendations as appropriate.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Global Security and Non-Proliferation
purpose: To encourage discussion and debate, on the basis of expert information and opinion from across the political spectrum, on matters relating to global security and the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction - whether nuclear, chemical or biological.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Golf
purpose: To support the sport of golf.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Golfing Society
purpose: To enable all MPs, Peers and staff in Parliament to play in golf matches, without being a member of any formal club, against other golf clubs in the UK, giving members of those clubs the opportunity to better understand the workings of Parliament.

title: Greater Manchester All-Party Parliamentary Group
purpose: To bring MPs and Peers of all parties together with key leaders - the Mayor and those in local government, the private and voluntary sectors, and social enterprise - to help maximise future investment in the region for the benefit of all the communities of Greater Manchester.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Green Deal Misselling
purpose: To gather evidence from constituents who have been missold home improvements such as solar panels or insulation from rogue traders operating under the Green Deal.  The group aims to find solutions for affected constituents and to prevent similar problems occurring under the new Green Deal.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Greyhound Group
purpose: To raise parliamentary awareness of issues relating to the greyhound industry.  To promote the sport and related welfare issues.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Gypsies, Travellers and Roma
purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians concerned about issues facing Gypsies, Travellers and Roma.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hadrian's Wall
purpose: To promote the 150 mile long UNESCO world heritage site and associated tourism outside of the north-east region; and to explore ways of increasing the importance of Hadrian's wall as an economic and cultural asset for every part of its route across the north-east and Cumbria.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Haemophilia and Contaminated Blood
purpose: To promote awareness of, and campaign for, people with haemophilia and other bleeding disorders and people infected with blood-borne viruses due to contaminated blood and blood products used in their healthcare treatment.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Hairdressing, Barbering and Cosmetology
purpose: To promote the role of qualified, professional hairdressers and barbers, and facilitate an informed debate amongst parliamentarians regarding all aspects of the industry.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hajj and Umrah
purpose: To establish facts about the UK Hajj and Umrah sectors; engage the sectors and identify and understand gaps, issues and trends; recommend ways to improve policy and good practice; and give a voice for stakeholders and consumers.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Health Group
purpose: The APPG is dedicated to disseminating knowledge, generating debate and facilitating engagement with health issues amongst Members of both Houses of Parliament.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Health in all Policies
purpose: To consider the effects of national public policy on the heatlh of UK populations - particularly on health inequalities between different population groups; to provide a discussion forum for parliamentarians; and to act as a source of well-evidenced and independent information on key social and public health issues.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Healthcare Infrastructure
purpose: To raise awareness of the importance of innovation in the physical infrastructure of health services. The group meets throughout the year to explore, discuss and debate key challenges facing the buildings, technology and facilities supporting the NHS and the needs of its patients.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Healthy Homes and Buildings
purpose: To bring together MPs and Peers of all parties together with policy makers, business leaders and industry experts to highlight the health and cost benefits which can be derived from constructing our buildings and homes to the highest levels of comfort, safety and energy efficiency.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Heart and Circulatory Diseases
purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians to work with experts across the health sector, patients and organisations to improve health outcomes for people living with heart and circulatory diseases in the UK.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Heathrow Expansion
purpose: To examine issues relating to the proposed expansion of Heathrow Airport and scrutinise the economic, environmental and social impacts of the proposal.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Heritage Rail
purpose: To brief parliamentarians about heritage railways, the contribution they make to their local and regional economies and the skills training opportunities involved.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Highways
purpose: To increase Members' knowledge and awareness of issues concerned with the proper provision and maintenance of our highways, with a focus on Local Authority roads.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hill Farming
purpose: To promote and protect hill farming interests and the communities that depend upon hill farming throughout the United Kingdom, raising issues of concern with government ministers, departments and relevant national assemblies.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Historic Vehicles
purpose: To encourage interest in, and the promotion and use of, vintage historic and classic vehicles.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on HIV and AIDS
purpose: To facilitate good policy-making, respectful of human rights, that will limit the spread of HIV, mitigate its impact and support those already living with the virus, in the UK and internationally, and to hold the government to account for its relevant commitments.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Hockey
purpose: To promote the sport of hockey in Parliament, support the sport's growth and increase general participation in hockey.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Holocaust Memorial
purpose: To promote holocaust memorial and education in Parliament; and to support the establishment of a holocaust memorial and learning centre.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Holy See
purpose: To act as a conduit for closer relations and better understanding between the UK and the Holy See, and to keep Members and Peers fully briefed about the global activities of the Catholic Church.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Home Electrical Safety
purpose: To raise parliamentary awareness of issues relating to electrical safety in domestic dwellings and to promote the prevention of accidents with electricity; to provide a forum for parliamentarians to discuss issues pertinent to their constituents on electrical safety; and to hold inquiries into policy issues and provide reports.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Ending Homelessness
purpose: To bring together parliamentarians of all parties with an interest in and commitment to ending homelessness; focus on all types of homelessness and differing solutions needed; make recommendations for the work of a wide range of departments who are key to ending homelessness.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on 'Honour'- Based Abuse
purpose: To debate and scrutinise issues relating to 'honour'-based abuse. To raise awareness of 'honour'-based abuse with a view to attempting to expose and eradicate such practices in the UK.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hormone Pregnancy Tests
purpose: To investigate the use of the drug 'Primodos' and other oral hormone pregnancy test drugs used in the 1960s and 1970s.  To support calls for an independent inquiry into the use of hormone pregnancy tests.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Horse
purpose: To promote the welfare of horses (including all equines, horse riders and users) and matters affecting the horse industry.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hospice and End of Life Care
purpose: To raise awareness and promote the needs of people living with terminal or life-shortening conditions, and their families and carers, in parliament; and to promote policies to improve care and support that are person-centred and evidence-based.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Hospitality
purpose: Enhancing our local economy by promoting measures and incentives, including a reduction of VAT on tourism, which would increase visitor numbers and investment in all parts of Britain and Northern Ireland.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Housing and Care for Older People
purpose: To promote discussion and set the agenda for developing better, more joined up housing care for older people, promising greater choices in later life.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Housing and Employment
purpose: To champion social housing providers that support many local people into employment; and to examine and share the most effective ways to support social housing tenants and residents into work, based on solid evidence and replicable practice.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Housing and Planning
purpose: To promote understanding of, and policy answers to, issues in housing and planning.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Housing in the North
purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians to discuss and advance housing and related policy, its impact across the north of England, and to set an agenda that seeks to ensure the needs and ambitions of northern communities are addressed in housing policy development.

title: All-Party Parliametnary Group on Human Gut Microbiome
purpose: To highlight the role of the gut microbiome in physical and mental health and its capacity to prevent many disorders and improve or slow others; to inform debate about how this will save money for the Treasury and NHS; and to enable communications between interested parties and relevant parliamentarians.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Human Rights Group
purpose: To raise the profile of international human rights issues within Parliament and to investigate and publicise human rights abuses occurring.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Human Trafficking and Modern Slavery
purpose: To raise awareness of the scale and effects of human trafficking into the UK and EU; to seek solutions to reduce supply and demand and to improve welfare provisions for victims.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Humanist Group
purpose: To bring together non-religious MPs and peers to discuss matters of shared interests.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hydrogen
purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians to engage with leading businesses and organisations that, in the context of the Climate Change Act and the Paris Agreement, are working to enable the UK to meet its decarbonisation targets through implementation of large scale hydrogen projects, and discuss policy options to support these.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Illicit Trade
purpose: To investigate and raise awareness of illicit trade in Britain, support closer working with parliamentarians to bring fresh impetus and ideas to tackling illicit trade and to highlight the impact on local businesses, high streets and communities.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Immigration Detention
purpose: To increase knowledge in Parliament on immigration detention in the UK and its impacts; to connect parliamentarians with relevant research, organisations and experts, including people with lived experience of detention; and to advocate for evidence-based policy reforms and the welfare of detainees.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Inclusive Growth
purpose: To create a parliamentary space for a high-level dialogue between MPs, peers, businesses, faith groups, trade unions and academics. The goal is to identify how to reconnect wealth creation and social justice.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Independent Education
purpose: To provide a forum to discuss developments in the independent education sector, discuss issues facing the sector, highlight best practice, explore the wider contribution of the sector, share knowledge, and raise matters affecting the sector with government and sector leaders.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Indian Traditional Sciences
purpose: To promote and facilitate informed discussions on issues concerning all Indian traditional sciences practised in the UK by providing a forum for cross-party parliamentarians, senior policy makers, academics, leading community figures and stakeholders.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Industrial Heritage
purpose: To promote the industrial heritage of the United Kingdom and aim to help support British industrial heritage sites in a time of austerity.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Infant Feeding and Inequalities
purpose: To raise awareness of infant feeding and allow MPs, Peers and policy stakeholders an opportunity to meet regularly to ensure that this topic remains a priority for HM Government with a view to reducing inequalities and improving health.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Inflammatory Bowel Disease
purpose: To work with Parliamentarians and stakeholders to raise awareness of Crohn's Disease, Ulcerative Colitis and other forms of Inflammatory Bowel Disease to ensure high quality, sustainable, patient-centred clinical care, drive pioneering research and reduce discrimination in accessing services across the UK.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Infrastructure
purpose: To highlight the importance of infrastructure, engineering and the use of underground space to the economy and society, and to hear from experts and discuss matters arising.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Inheritance and Intergenerational Fairness
purpose: To promote understanding of the issues generated by inheritance and intergenerational fairness and to facilitate discussion on methods of reform.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the UK's Innovation Corridor
purpose: To champion the UK's Innovation Corridor that runs between London and Cambridge as a vital region to support economic growth, the delivery of new homes and the creation of skilled jobs.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Insurance and Financial Services
purpose: To examine issues of interest to the insurance and broader financial sectors, especially where there are legislative implications.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Integrated Healthcare
purpose: To provide a forum for discussion on issues related to integrated healthcare; to stimulate well-informed debate among politicians and stakeholders; and to contribute towards the development of knowledge and policies on the subject.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Intellectual Property
purpose: To debate and highlight the value of intellectual property (IP) and the importance of its promotion and protection. The Group meets several times a year on topical issues relating to intellectual property.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Intelligent Energy
purpose: To develop among parliamentarians and key opinion formers a deeper understanding of energy efficiency and sustainable energy technologies and processes through parliamentary activity, public information and broad political debate.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Inter-Faith Group
purpose: To raise awareness amongst parliamentarians of the religious dimension to current issues.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on International Conservation
purpose: To provide a forum to address wildlife conservation and biodiversity issues affecting our planet including but not limited to ecosystem collapse, species extinctions, land degradation, invasive species, illegal fishing and other threats to the natural world.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for International Students
purpose: To recognise the internationalisation and global prominence of UK education; promote the value of international students to UK education, economy and 'soft power'; raise awareness of issues which affect international students and UK education; and provide a platform for collaboration between parliamentarians, international education institutions and professionals and business leaders.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for International Trade and Investment
purpose: To discuss ways in which the UK government can help UK businesses export and take part in international trade and promote links between parliamentarians, industry and government.

title: Parliamentary Internet, Communications and Technology Forum (an All-Party Parliamentary Group)
purpose: To further understanding of policy issues affecting the internet, communications and technology sector between parliamentarians, the industry, consumer groups and academia.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Islamic Finance
purpose: To give the Islamic finance industry a voice in Parliament; to address issues as they arise such as Sukuk issuances, inclusivity, regulation and taxation whilst positioning the UK as the European hub of Islamic financial services, and also to play a wider role in promoting ethical finance.

title: All-Party Parliamentary ITV Group
purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians to consider and discuss the role and contribution of ITV in broadcasting in the UK and regulatory issues.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Jainism
purpose: To raise the profile of Jainism in the UK.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Jazz Appreciation
purpose: To encourage wider and deeper enjoyment of jazz, to increase parliamentarians' understanding of the jazz industry and issues surrounding it, to promote jazz as a musical form and to raise its profile inside and outside Parliament.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Kidney Group
purpose: To improve understanding in Parliament of kidney disease and transplant medicine and promote improvements in the health and care services that are available to improve the health of people with renal failure.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Knife Crime
purpose: To evaluate policies and programmes aimed at reducing knife crime, gain better understanding of its root causes and the wider context of youth violence, and develop recommendations for new measures at both acute and preventative stages with a view to reducing levels of knife crime.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Kurds in Iran
purpose: To raise the condition of the Kurdish people in Iran.  To raise awareness of solidarity and engagement for building democratic, free relationships by encouraging dialogue and discussions.  To support efforts of developing and consolidating democracy, peaceful co-existence and harmony in the region.  To organise cultural and social events, workshops and seminars to raise awareness of solidarity, development and the needs of the region.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Kurds in Turkey
purpose: To raise the condition of the Kurdish people in Turkey.  To raise awareness of solidarity and engagement for building democratic, free relationships by encouraging dialogue and discussions.  To support efforts of developing and consolidating democracy, peaceful co-existence and harmony in the region.  To organise cultural and social events, workshops and seminars to raise awareness of solidarity, development and the needs of the region.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Land Value Capture
purpose: To work in partnership with national and local government departments, land developers and others to create a forum for parliamentarians and interested stakeholders to discuss and develop innovative proposals to capture increases in land value, for the public benefit.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Learning Disability
purpose: To look at the issues facing people with a learning disability and their families. The group looks at the key issues of the day, across areas including health, social care, education, work and benefits.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Leasehold and Commonhold Reform
purpose: To examine the complex, antiquated legal matrix governing leasehold tenure in England; analyse the effects of investigatory powers by Government and regulatory bodies within the leasehold sector on protecting leaseholders from exploitation; explore how our current leasehold laws and systems can be improved and the implementation of commonhold tenure, as it is intended.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Legal Aid
purpose: To promote parliamentary and public understanding of the importance of the role of publically funded legal services.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Legal and Constitutional Affairs
purpose: To facilitate greater interaction between Parliament and the different branches of the legal profession, and to promote dialogue and understanding of legal and constitutional issues relating to justice and the legal services sector.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Global Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender Rights
purpose: To advance LGBT rights around the world. We provide a forum for parliamentarians and organisations across the public, private and third sectors to work together to champion LGBT rights and push back against abuse and discrimination. We principally focus on international LGBT rights but include domestic issues within our remit.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Life Sciences
purpose: To raise awareness and understanding of the valuable contribution the life sciences sector provides to the health and wealth of the nation.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Light Rail Group
purpose: To encourage, promote and develop light rail, trams and environs and its benefits as a mode of transport.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Limits to Growth
purpose: To create the space for cross-party dialogue on environmental and social limits to growth; to assess the evidence for such limits, identify the risks and build support for appropriate responses; and to contribute to the international debate on redefining prosperity.

title: Lipoedema All-Party Parliamentary Group
purpose: To support and increase awareness within Parliament, healthcare professionals and the wider public, so as to increase correct diagnosis and treatment available to the many people affected by this painful, uncomfortable and unsightly condition, often undiagnosed for years or misdiagnosed as obesity or lymphoedema.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Listed Properties
purpose: To speak up for listed properties in the UK and raise awareness in Parliament of the role played by their owners in protecting the nation's heritage; and to advocate policies that support owners in preserving listed properties, including tax and planning reform.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Literacy
purpose: To champion the fight to improve public understanding of the vital importance and impact of literacy and to ensure parliamentary knowledge and support for the latest research, policy and best practice in the field of literacy.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Liver Health
purpose: To promote discussion of liver disease, including its major causes of viral hepatitis, alcohol and obesity, and to raise matters of concern with, and make representations to, government and other policy makers.

title: Liverpool City Region All-Party Parliamentary Group
purpose: To bring MPs and Peers of all parties together with key leaders, including the Liverpool City Region Metro Mayor and those in local government, the private sector and social enterprise, to help maximise future investment in the wider Liverpool City Region for the benefit of all its local communities.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Loan Charge Group
purpose: To raise concerns about the 2019 Loan Charge, which will affect thousands of freelance, contract and locum workers in the UK as well as the wider context of fairness of tax legislation and the conduct of Her Majesty's Revenue and Customs.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Local Authority Pension Funds
purpose: To discuss the issues and concerns of local authority pension funds and the work of the Local Authority Pension Fund Forum.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Local Democracy
purpose: To promote the virtues of exiting forms of first tier local authorities; to inform policy making and initiatives affecting first tier local authorities; and to stimulate debate on models of community governance.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Local Government
purpose: To discuss issues of interest and concern to parliamentarians and councillors about local government.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for London
purpose: To promote London in the interests of all its people, places and businesses as a global city and powerhouse of the economy.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for London's Green Belt
purpose: To advocate Green Belt-friendly planning policies and contribute to the debate on how best to achieve sustainable development that protects London's Green Belt for the benefit of future generations.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for London's Planning and Built Environment
purpose: To explore the social, economic and environmental issues affecting London at a strategic level and build consensus as to the ways in which these might be addressed.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Loneliness
purpose: To drive forward cross-party work among parliamentarians to influence legislation and policy making in order to reduce loneliness and build on the work of the Jo Cox Commission on Loneliness.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Longevity
purpose: Cross-disciplinary exchange on benefits of longevity (as opposed to 'problems' of ageing) within an ethical, citizen-centred framework to maximise the societal benefits of enabling healthier, more productive and purposeful lives.  AI and data-driven solutions to increase healthspan and democratise access to the 'longevity dividend' for citizens will be a focus.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Looked After Children and Care Leavers
purpose: To promote the voice of children and young people in care, in order to promote first class government policy for children in care and care leavers.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Malaria and Neglected Tropical Diseases
purpose: To raise awareness of malaria and neglected tropical diseases amongst parliamentarians; and to encourage the UK Government to provide political will, leadership and sustainable funding for the necessary prevention and treatment of these diseases.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Management
purpose: To drive UK productivity and social well-being through promoting closer understanding between parliamentarians and UK managers and leaders from across all sectors.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Manufacturing Group
purpose: To encourage the exchange of knowledge and understanding between Parliament and the manufacturing industries, helping to raise the profile of manufacturing both inside and outside of Parliament.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Marine Energy and Tidal Lagoons
purpose: To promote the economic, supply chain and energy security benefits from the development of marine energy resources in and around the UK.

title: All-Party Parliamentary Maritime and Ports Group
purpose: To provide a forum for the exchange of views between parliamentarians and leading figures in the shipping, ports and maritime business industries.
